Your Quarterly Notes From Justia Connect 

Welcome to your quarterly updates from Justia Connect, the membership program connecting legal professionals with benefits and resources to achieve their professional and practice-growth goals.

Be sure to check out this email for helpful tips from our Justia Connect team, featured discounts from Justia Deals, and the latest information on maximizing your free Justia Connect membership benefits.

Community Tips

Take Advantage of CLE Courses

Take advantage of professional development courses with your Justia Connect membership! Our free Justia Webinars are open to all members and explore a broad array of topics, including law practice management, legal marketing, substantive legal developments, professional ethics, and more. Please note that while all Justia Connect members are invited to attend Justia Webinars, only Justia Connect Pros are eligible to earn CLE credit.

Upcoming Presentations
Virtual Isolation: Is Hyperconnectivity Helping or Harming the Legal Professional?

Recent studies have shown that there has been a dramatic increase in impairment due to alcoholism, addiction, and mental health disorders among members of the legal profession. What role does an always-connected society and technology play in this phenomenon? Explore this question in our upcoming webinar led by Brian S. Quinn of Lawyers Concerned for Lawyers of Pennsylvania. Please note this webinar is approved for one hour of California Competence Issues MCLE credit.

News From Justia

Canadian Judge Rules That Emoji Constitutes Assent in a Contract

As various states begin to enact laws banning certain types of gender-affirming care for transgender minors, legal challenges are beginning to result in different outcomes in courts across the country. Recently in Montana, a judge temporarily blocked such a ban imposed by the legislature, and judges in other jurisdictions and federal courts have issued similar orders. However, the U.S. Sixth Circuit recently reached a different conclusion, reversing preliminary injunctions against gender-affirming care bans in Tennessee and Kentucky.

Catch up on this and other breaking news on the Justia Legal News Blog.
